19 
20 cv::Mat Segment(Mat img){
21  //create the result image the same dimensions as the original
22  int img_row = img.rows;
23  int img_col = img.cols;
24  Mat resultImg(img_row, img_col, CV_32F, cv::Scalar(100));
25 
26  //iterate through the image
27  for(int i = 0; i < img_row; i++){
28  for(int j = 0; j < img_col; j++){
29  resultImg.at<float>(i, j) = 2* (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[0] - (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[1] - (int)img.at<Vec3b>(i, j)[2]; //2B-R-G img = BGR
30  }
31 
32  }
33 
34  //converte the result image to 8U
35  resultImg.convertTo(resultImg, CV_8U);
36 
37  return resultImg;
38 }

60 cv::Mat Camera::imageCb(const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& msg)
61  {
62  cv_bridge::CvImagePtr cv_ptr;
63  cv::Mat image;
64  try
65  {
66  cv_ptr = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, sensor_msgs::image_encodings::BGR8);
67  image = cv_ptr->image;
68  return image;
69  }
70  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e)
71  {
72  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge exception: %s", e.what());
73  return image;
74  }
75  }

77 Camera::Camera()
78 {
79  ros::NodeHandle node("~");
80 
81  sub_camera = node.subscribe("sub_topic", 1000, &Camera::callbackCamera, this); //Camera-image
82 
83  tf_pub = node.advertise<std_msgs::String>("pub_cam_tf", 1);
84 
85 }
86 
87 void Camera::callbackCamera(const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& cameraImage)
88 {
89  //std::cout << "CALLBACK" << std::endl;
90  //std::cout << "Bildbreite: " << cameraImage.width << "\tBildhöhe: " << cameraImage.height << std::endl;
91  //output = cameraImage.width.toString();
92  if(cameraImage->width != 0){
93  m_cameraImage = imageCb(cameraImage);
94  ImageProcessing();
95  }
96  tf_pub.publish(output);
97 }
98 
99 void Camera::ImageProcessing(){
100  //get a copy of the current frame
101  cv::Mat img = m_cameraImage.clone();
102  //cout << "\n\n\n\n" << "image cols: " << img.cols << "\n"; //=640
103  //segment by blue
104  cv::Mat img_segment = Segment(img);
105  cv::Mat img_edges, img_result;
106  //get the edges of the segmentd
107  cv::Canny(img_segment, img_edges, 0, 10, 5);
108  //get the countours of the edges
109  vector<vector<cv::Point> > contours;
110  vector<cv::Vec4i> hierarchy;
111  cv::findContours(img_edges.clone(), contours, hierarchy, CV_RETR_CCOMP, CV_CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE);
112 
113  if(contours.size() > 0){
114  //use the contours to find the center of the ball
115  vector<RotatedRect> minEllipse( contours.size() );
116  for( size_t i = 0; i < contours.size(); i++ )
117  {
118  //if the contour is big enough fit an ellips around it
119  if( contours[i].size() > 5 )
120  {
121  minEllipse[i] = fitEllipse( contours[i] );
122  }
123  }
124  //counter to save the biggest ellipse
125  int NumberBiggest = 0;
126 
127  for( size_t i = 0; i < contours.size(); i++ ){
128  //draw the ellipses
129  //find the widest ellipse
130  if(minEllipse[NumberBiggest].size.width < minEllipse[i].size.width ){
131  NumberBiggest = i;
132  }
133  }
134  cv::Point2f center = minEllipse[NumberBiggest].center;
135  ellipse( img, minEllipse[NumberBiggest], CV_RGB(((int)rand() % 255), ((int)rand() % 255), ((int)rand() % 255)), 2 );
136  circle( img, center, 5, Scalar( 0, 0, 255 ), FILLED, LINE_8 );
137  //cout << "\n\n" << "center x: " << center.x << " y: " << center.y << "\n";
138 
139  float image_fifth = img.cols/5;
140  if(center.x <= image_fifth){
141  output.data = "1";
142  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*2){
143  output.data = "2";
144  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*3){
145  output.data = "3";
146  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*4){
147  output.data = "4";
148  }else if(center.x <= image_fifth*5){
149  output.data = "5";
150  }
151  //cout << "\n\n" << "output: " << output << " center.x: " << center.x << "\n";
152 
153  }else{
154  output.data = "0";
155  }
156 
157  cv::imshow("test", img);
158  cv::waitKey(20);
159 }
